title: Direction

renewed-contributions.title: A Knife to Cut the Corn Bread With
Hard-Boiled
renewed-contributions.note: Renewal record gives title as 'Hard Boiled'

renewed-contributions.title: Don't Hit a Woman
renewed-contributions.note: A chapter from his autobiography 'The Big Sea'. Renewal record labels the issue as June 1940

renewed-contributions.title: A Pound of Fresh Tomatoes
renewed-contributions.note: Renewal record credits both people, and gives the issue as June 1940; however, it actually ran in the October 1940 issue, where it is credited only to Helen. Title on inside magazine page is 'For a Pound of Fresh Tomatoes'

renewed-contributions.title: Richard Wright and Negro Fiction
renewed-contributions.note: Title on inside magazine page is 'Richard Wright and Recent Negro Fiction'

renewed-contributions.title: Philippine Writers Report
renewed-contributions.note: Title on inside magazine page is 'Philippine Report'

renewed-contributions.title: Little Car in Virginia
renewed-contributions.note: Renewal record dates the issue as June 15, 1942

additional-note: A 1972 renewal for 'Anything Can Happen' by George and Helen Waite Papashvily mentions that one chapter was previously published in Direction in 1940. I consider this renewal to be too late to cover the magazine publication, but note that there is a timely renewal for a 1940 Papashvily work above.
